title.narrative: MULTI-SECTORAL COMMUNITY BASED SUPPORT

description.narrative: New Element, which contributes to Access To Inclusive Social Protection, Operations Support To Programme Delivery, Reducing Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2025, vulnerable children and families benefit from improved child protection and social protection services

related-activity.ref: 4350/A0/06/883 IMPROVED CHILD PROTECTION AND SOCIAL PROTECTION SERVICES

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: New Element

description.narrative: UNICEF Field Office enhanced partnerships with Gaziantep, Sanliurfa and Kilis Municipalities and with key Civil Society Organizations (CSOs) working with vulnerable populations in 11 provinces in Southeast Turkey. These partnerships resulted in improved access to quality education, child protection and adolescent development services for vulnerable host community and refugee children and their families. The municipalities have enabled integrated provision of social services to vulnerable children through direct service delivery and by connecting different public service providers and CSOs. Through seasonal cash assistance programme provided by UNICEF, 23,000 vulnerable individuals in Hatay have increased capacity for their needs for winter season. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:21/01/2022
